intro: Oldenlandia goreensis var. trichocaula, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is notable for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
